intro: Inversodicraea rubra, commonly known as the red-flowered inversodicraea, is a member of the Rubiaceae family, native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking red flowers, which are typically clustered in umbel-like inflorescences. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are often hairy, and it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies, due to their vibrant color and nectar production. Despite its ornamental value, it is relatively rare and requires specific growing conditions to flourish.
